Istana Mulai Cek Keberadaan 'Desa Hantu' Penyedot Dana Desa
07 Nov 2019, 04:57 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Fadjroel Rachman (Andhika-detikcom)

Jakarta - Fenomena adanya desa tak berpenduduk alias 'desa hantu' yang menikmati aliran dana desa menjadi geger. Pasalnya, sejak dilaksanakan pada 2015 baru akhir-akhir ini diungkapkan Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati adanya kasus tersebut.Pihak Istana Kepresidenan pun mengaku tengah mengumpulkan data mengenai keberadaan desa tersebut benar adanya atau hanya cerita belaka."Kami sedang kumpulkan data. Karena dari pihak Menkeu pernyataan demikian, kami kumpulkan data, apakah nyata ada di lapangan," kata Juru Bicara (Jubir) Presiden, Fadjroel Rachman di komplek Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis (7/11/2019).Kementerian Keuangan mengalokasikan anggaran dana desa sebesar Rp 70 triliun di tahun 2019. Indonesia memiliki 74.597 desa di 2019, di mana setiap desa mendapatkan anggaran sekitar Rp 900 juta."Kami di tim jubir juga sedang melakukan, mengumpulkan informasi-informasi tentang apa yang berkembang," jelas dia.Informasi yang tengah dikumpulkan ini untuk memastikan bahwa alokasi dana desa benar-benar mengalir atau tidak."Ada yang mengatakan dari 70.400 desa itu ada dana yang tidak sampai atau ada desa yang tidak ada. Segala macam, kami sedang kumpulkan. Nanti data itu akan kami berikan pada Pak Mensesneg untuk diberikan pada informasi atau pendapat langsung dari beliau," ungkap dia. text:
Palace Begins to Check the Existence of 'Village Ghost' Village Fund Suction
Nov 7 2019, 04:57 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Fadjroel Rachman (Andhika-detikcom)

Jakarta - The phenomenon of an uninhabited village, aka 'ghost village', that enjoys the flow of village funds has become tantrum. The reason is that since it was implemented in 2015 it was only recently that the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati disclosed the case. The Presidential Palace also claimed that they were collecting data about the existence of the village or it was a mere story. "We are currently collecting data. Because from the Minister of Finance such statement, we collect data, is there real in the field, "said Presidential Spokesman (Spokesman), Fadjroel Rachman at the Presidential Palace complex, Central Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). The Ministry of Finance allocates a village budget of Rp. 70 trillion in 2019. Indonesia has 74,597 villages in 2019, where each village gets a budget of around Rp 900 million. "We in the spokesman team are also doing, gathering information about what is developing," he explained. The information being collected is to ensure that the allocation of village funds actually flows or not. "Some say of the 70,400 villages there are funds that do not arrive or there are villages that don't exist. All kinds, we are gathering. Later we will give the data to the Minister of State Secretariat to provide information or opinions directly from him, "he said.
